DOC.HEAD: 22 More Reported Killed in Sri Lanka
DOC.TEXT: Fourteen bodies were found in the central hill district a day after pro-government vigilantes killed at least 170 suspected militants in another part of the country, military officials said Friday. Elsewhere, eight other people were killed Friday in the ethnic violence, officials said. The officials, who cannot be identified under briefing rules, said the latest bodies were found in the Kandy district Thursday night and early Friday, and were believed to be Sinhalese radicals killed by vigilantes. They said the victims had been shot and the bodies burned to prevent identification. On Thursday, officials said 170 radicals had been killed in the southern Hambantota district since Wednesday night. In other areas of the country, at least four radicals were killed by police and three civilians and a soldier were killed by the militants, the officials said. At least 6,000 people have been killed since Sinhalese radicals began trying to overthrow the government in July 1987. The radicals say the government made too many concessions in a peace agreement designed to end a civil war started by Tamil separatists in 1983 that has taken about 8,000 lives. Three-quarters of Sri Lanka's 16 million people are ethnic Sinhalese. Tamils make up 18 percent of the population and claim discrimination by the Sinhalese, who control the government and military.
